p: As mentioned, while performing biological activity studies, several drug-like properties (physico-chemical parameters, stability, photostability, intestinal permeability, albumin binding, toxicity, etc.) were simultaneously investigated [ 66, 73]. While showing favourable permeability parameters, the ability of dihydroxylated xanthones for P-gp activation was disclosed with 3,6-dihydroxyxanthone ( 8) being the most active. Further studies pointed their putative application as antidotes of paraquat, by protection against the cytotoxicity induced by this pesticide P-gp substrate [ 57, 58, 74].
